thread.title: Trade unions hijacked Greece's Finance Ministry with a huge anti-austerity banner
thread.title_full: Trade unions hijacked Greece's Finance Ministry with a huge anti-austerity banner

author: Oscar Williams-Grut
title: Trade unions hijacked Greece's Finance Ministry with a huge anti-austerity banner
text:
print 
Greece's Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras is calling for the nation to vote "No" in Sunday's bailout referendum and there's a huge banner on a key public building saying the same thing. 
A banner has gone up on Greece's Finance Ministry in Athens that reads "No to blackmail and austerity" in both Greek and English. 
REUTERS/Yannis Behrakis A banner is seen unfolded from a balcony of the Finance Ministry in Athens, Greece, July 1, 2015. 
Despite it echoing Tsipras' call to the Greek people, the government has distanced itself from the banner. Greece's Finance Minister Yanis Varoufakis blamed trade unions, tweeting this: 
@tjibbe_hoekstra Not in my name. The said banner was the initiative of trades unionists - who did not seek the Ministry's permission. â€” Yanis Varoufakis (@yanisvaroufakis) July 1, 2015 The Unions may have been spurred to hang the banner following the release of Tsipras' latest letter to Greece's creditors , dated June 30, which leaked earlier today. The letter show Tsipras caving in to most of the Eurogroup's demands and the banner went up in the hours inbetween the leak and Tsipras' public address in which he backed a "No" vote .
